title: Cadbury's Easter range unveiled and it has tins of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs
text:

Easter might still be six months away - and we've still got Christmas to get through - but that isn't stopping Cadbury from starting off proceedings early.

And this year, for the first time ever, they're selling tubs of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs.

Each of the tins will set you back £5.99 each , and will be available to buy from early next year. Just in time for when the Christmas rations run out...

Whilst the Creme Egg tub contains 409g of the fondant-filled goodies, the Mini Eggs tin weighs in at a slightly less 319g.

(Image: Cadbury)

If you were to buy everything separately, a full-size Creme Egg weighs 34g and costs about 50p, or you can get a pack of five for around £1.65.

Therefore, the 409g tub works out at about the same weight as twelve creme eggs, which would cost you £6 - meaning you're getting the same amount of chocolate for your money no matter which option you go for.

(Image: Cadbury)

As for Mini Eggs, a 90g bag was priced at £1.15 on average this Easter, meaning that a 319g tin is the same weight as three and a half bags of the glorious Easter treat, so you may be losing out on a quid or two by opting for the tin, which costs just under £2 more than the price of three and a half bags of mini eggs.

However, there's no word on whether the tubs are filled with full-size or miniature versions of the iconic Easter chocolate, which could change things completely.

As well as the new tubs, Cadbury will also be selling a Bourneville Easter egg, which features a whole bar of the dark chocolate, weighing 115g and priced at £3.99.
description: Cadbury will sell tubs of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs for Easter - and they'll be on sale right after Christmas
